mean_cn: adj. 综合的，完整的，互相协调的
mean_en: allowing all types of people to participate or be included :not segregated
word_etyma:
integr 整，全 + ate 使之成...+d → adj. 综合的；完整的；互相协调的
v. 整合；使…成整体（integrate的过去分词）
sentence: The U.S. is now much more racially integrated than it used to be.
sentence_trans: 美国的种族问题比原来更协调了。
